[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Derive: Clone] [Deep Copy Cost] Can cloning Block or BcsBlock with large transactions vectors cause performance degradation enabling API slowdown attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Derive: Debug] [Information Disclosure] Does Debug implementation for Block expose sensitive internal state in logs that could aid attackers in reconnaissance? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: Block] [Field Consistency] Can block_timestamp be less than previous block's timestamp, violating monotonic time assumption in consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: Block] [Field Consistency] Can block_height be non-sequential (e.g., skipping heights), causing gaps in block history and breaking light client sync? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: BcsBlock] [Field Consistency] If first_version equals last_version, does the single transaction in transactions vec match the expected version? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: BcsBlock] [Genesis Block] Can block_height=0 have first_version!=0 or vice versa, creating inconsistent genesis block representation? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: Block] [Hash Verification] Is block_hash recomputed and verified after deserialization to prevent hash manipulation attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: Block] [API Exposure] Can Block be constructed directly via API without going through proper validation in api/src/context.rs, bypassing security checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: BcsBlock] [Rate Limiting] Can repeated requests for BcsBlock with transactions=Some exhaust database connections, causing API unavailability? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: Block] [Caching Attack] If Block responses are cached, can an attacker poison cache with invalid blocks causing stale data propagation? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: BcsBlock] [Pruning Bypass] Can BcsBlock reference pruned versions (first_version < oldest_ledger_version) without proper error handling? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: Block] [Version Lookup] When converting BcsBlock to Block, can version-to-transaction mapping fail silently, returning incomplete transaction lists? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Type: U64] [String Parsing] Can U64 wrapper accept malformed string inputs during JSON deserialization (e.g., '1e20'), causing incorrect numeric interpretation? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Type: U64] [Leading Zeros] Can U64 accept strings with leading zeros (e.g., '00123') that might be interpreted differently across systems? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Type: U64] [Negative Values] Can U64 deserialization accept negative string values (e.g., '-1') that wrap around to large positive u64 values? (High)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Type: HashValue] [Invalid Hex] Can HashValue wrapper accept non-hex characters or incorrect length hashes, causing validation bypass? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Type: HashValue] [Case Sensitivity] Is HashValue hex parsing case-sensitive, and can mixed case hashes cause duplicate block detection failures? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Type: Transaction] [Type Safety] Can Transaction enum variants be mismatched with actual transaction types in the transactions vec? (High)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: Block] [Race Condition] Can Block be modified after construction while being served by API, causing inconsistent reads of block fields? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: BcsBlock] [Concurrent Serialization] Can concurrent BCS serialization of same BcsBlock produce different byte sequences due to non-deterministic field ordering? (High)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: Block] [Clone Safety] Is Block.clone() thread-safe when transactions vec is being populated, or can it create partially initialized clones? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: Block] [Version Overflow] Can last_version be set to u64::MAX causing overflow when calculating next block's first_version? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: BcsBlock] [Version Gap] Can there be gaps between consecutive blocks (block_n.last_version + 1 != block_n+1.first_version), breaking chain continuity? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: BcsBlock] [Version Overlap] Can two blocks have overlapping version ranges (e.g., both contain version 100), causing double-execution vulnerabilities? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/block.rs] [Struct: Block] [Zero Versions] Can a block have first_version=0 and last_version=0 representing only genesis transaction, and is this handled correctly? (Low)
